title: Tea polyphenol EGCG enhances the improvements of calorie restriction on hepatic steatosis and obesity while reducing its adverse outcomes in obese rats.
abstract: Currently, calorie restriction (CR) is popular among young people as a way to lose weight and prevent obesity. However, CR can also cause a series of side effects, such as weight regain after resuming free eating. Tea polyphenol epigallocatechin-3-gallate (EGCG) has been widely recognized as antiobesity effects. However, whether EGCG can enhance the antiobesity effect of CR and reduce its adverse outcomes is still unclear.
journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology
